text: Bell Lake Provincial Park is a provincial park on the north shore of Bell Lake in the Porcupine Provincial Forest, Manitoba, Canada. It is in size. It was designated as a provincial park in 1974. The park is located within the Porcupine Hills Ecodistrict in the Mid-Boreal Uplands Ecoregion within the Boreal Plains Ecozone. ==See also== *List of protected areas of Manitoba *List of provincial parks in Manitoba ==References== ==External links== * Category:Provincial parks of Manitoba Category:Protected areas established in 1961 Category:1961 establishments in Manitoba
title: Bell Lake Provincial Park
